thread.title: Brittany Cartwright claps back at body shamers, embracing her curves | Marca
thread.title_full: Brittany Cartwright claps back at body shamers, embracing her curves | Marca

author: LW
title: Brittany Cartwright claps back at body shamers, embracing her curves | Marca
text: Brittany Cartwright, known for her role on "Vanderpump Rules," is not one to stay silent in the face of body shaming. The reality TV star recently took to Instagram to share glamorous photos of herself in a black corset-style dress, only to receive comments criticizing her figure. One commenter remarked that Cartwright's breasts were too big, making her look heavier than she is. However, the celebrity didn't let the negativity slide. She fired back, stating, "Could you imagine me going on your page and commenting on your body? Yes, my boobs are big, cool." Despite the trolls, Cartwright received plenty of support, including from her estranged husband, Jax Taylor, who left fire and heart emojis on her post. Taylor has been a strong presence in Cartwright's life, even contributing to her body transformation journey. Ver esta publicación en Instagram Una publicación compartida por Brittany Cartwright (@brittany) Brittany's journey to self-esteem Cartwright previously underwent breast augmentation, which was funded by Taylor. The procedure was done with the intention of enhancing her natural curves and boosting her confidence. Additionally, she has undergone treatments such as Kybella injections and liposuction to address areas of concern, such as fat underneath her chin. Beyond her physical appearance, Cartwright has been candid about her personal struggles and triumphs, including her weight loss journey after giving birth to her son, Cruz. Despite their separation, Cartwright has praised Taylor for being a supportive co-parent. #TheValley Brittany Cartwright claps back at troll claiming her 'big' chest makes her look 'heavier'The "Valley" star didn't mince words when a follower left a comment on her Instagram post that criticized her figure.https://t.co/weRB8pvSwx pic.twitter.com/R4NEep1I9S? Brightly (@BrightlyAgain) April 18, 2024 Cartwright is an example to follow In other news, Cartwright recently enjoyed a girls' trip to Malibu, California, as seen on the latest episode of "The Valley." During the trip, Cartwright opened up about her relationship with Taylor, expressing her desire for more positivity and support from him. As Cartwright continues to navigate life's challenges, she remains a beacon of strength and resilience, inspiring others to embrace their bodies and stand up against body shaming.
